meanings.definition: To ask or inquire about something.
meanings.sent1: She was quiring about the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys quiring about different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The cat was quiring about the mysterious noise.
meanings.sent4: The detective was quiring about the missing necklace.
meanings.sent5: Quiring politely, she asked for directions to the nearest store.

meanings.definition: A group of four sheets of paper folded together to form eight leaves in a book or manuscript.
meanings.sent1: The old book had a quiring that was falling apart.
meanings.sent2: The librarian carefully handled the delicate quiring.
meanings.sent3: The quiring on the desk reminded him of ancient scrolls.
meanings.sent4: She marveled at the intricate design on the quiring.
meanings.sent5: The quiring contained valuable information about the history of the town.
